fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • One of the jazz shows previewed in this week’s Guide, Sam Jesson Magpie Trio in Leeds on Tuesday (page 25), was cancelled after the supplement went to press. The trio’s touring plans can be found at samjesson.co.uk • A kitchen aide feature misattributed to Jane Grigson a recipe for “jugged celery”. In fact it came from Dorothy Hartley’s 1954 book Food In England (What do you do with the rest of a bunch of celery?, 30 November, page 20, Feast). • Other recently corrected articles include: Robert Freeman obituary Sajid Javid got it wrong on homelessness. It’s been rising since 2010 Dodgy diplomats: how envoys misuse their immunity Bye caramba! The Simpsons composer claims the show is ‘coming to an end’
